issue.title: [C++]: Undefined Behavior sanitizer build option fails with GCC
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-6992](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6992). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Then build with the "undefined behaviour sanitizer" option (-DARROW_USE_UBSAN=ON) the compilation fails with GCC:
```

c++: error: unrecognized argument to ‘-fno-sanitize=’ option: ‘function’
```
It appears that GCC has never had a "-fsanitize=function" option.

I have fixed this issue and will submit a PR.
